definition: to gather (people)/to collect (talent)/to come to an end
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo

sentences.english: Use broad range of sources for improvement ideas.
sentences.chinese: 大范围的收罗改良倡议。

sentences.english: She hunted many bargains at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 她在集市上收罗到许多便宜货。

sentences.english: To assist physicians in a variety of therapeutic work, is responsible for collecting all kinds of test specimens.
sentences.chinese: 帮助医师举行各种医治工作，担当收罗各种检验标本。

sentences.english: Consequently tourists come everyone tickets are collected.
Many years ago, Mandi went around in those villages out of the way collecting title deed for land.
sentences.chinese: 十几年前，壹霖开始狂走偏僻村落，收罗地契古书。

sentences.english: Preserving the structure of the state, gathering the valiant and courageous are what the Middle Strategy is.
sentences.chinese: 保全国家，收罗英雄，就是《中略》所论的权变。

net for fishing or bird catching/(fig.) fetters/to snare (a valuable new team member etc)/to bring together under the one umbrella
rare treasure (idiom)

to win the support of/to get over to one's side/to keep control of
to coax/to beguile/to win over
to raise (animals)
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay

to select very carefully
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in

to gather/to rake together/to pile up
